title: Here Are Airports That Could Be Affected by the Air Traffic Slowdown
summary: The cuts to flights are expected to begin Friday and deepen over the weekend to reach a 10 percent reduction in air traffic.

title: Trump Announces Deal to Drop Obesity Drug Prices to as Little as $150 a Month
summary: President Trump announced a deal with Eli Lilly and Novo Nordisk to lower prices on hugely popular weight-loss drugs for Medicare, Medicaid and American patients who pay with their own money.

title: Nancy Pelosi Announces Retirement From Congress in 2027
summary: Representative Nancy Pelosi, the only female House speaker, said she will not run for re-election. She wielded immense power and became a Democratic icon, while she was demonized by conservatives.

title: As Mamdani Surges Ahead, Schumer Risks Finding Himself Left Behind
summary: The rise of New York City’s mayor-elect comes at a complicated moment in the career of Senator Chuck Schumer, who is in danger of looking out of touch with the prevailing energy back home.

title: Two Signs That Democrats Flipped Trump Supporters on Tuesday
summary: It wasn’t just about superior turnout. Party switchers played a significant role in Virginia and New Jersey.

title: Nick Fuentes’s Rise Puts MAGA Movement in a ‘Time of Choosing’
summary: After Mr. Fuentes’s interview with Tucker Carlson, Republicans are considering just how far his views are from the nationalism embraced by President Trump’s followers.

title: Trump vs. Mamdani: President Sees a Capable Foil in New York’s Next Mayor
summary: President Trump has berated Zohran Mamdani, the mayor-elect of New York City, in public. But privately, Mr. Trump describes him as slick and a good talker.

title: Are A.I. Therapy Chatbots Safe to Use?
summary: Psychologists and technologists see them as the future of therapy. The Food and Drug Administration is exploring whether to regulate them as medical devices.

title: How A.I. and Social Media Contribute to ‘Brain Rot’
summary: A.I. search tools, chatbots and social media are associated with lower cognitive performance, studies say. What to do?

title: The Florentine Diamond Resurfaces After 100 Years in Hiding
summary: A legendary jewel of the Hapsburg dynasty — not seen since 1919 and thought lost, stolen or recut — has actually been safe in a Canadian bank for decades.

title: The ‘Worst Test in Medicine’ is Driving America’s High C-Section Rate
summary: Round-the-clock fetal monitoring leads to unnecessary C-sections. But it’s used in nearly every birth because of business and legal concerns, The Times found.

title: A Grave Condition Caused by C-Sections Is on the Rise
summary: Placenta accreta is a life-threatening condition in which the placenta attaches to scar tissue left by a C-section. It used to be extremely rare.

title: Judy Garland’s ‘Lucky Jacket’ Returns to Carnegie Hall
summary: She wore it at Carnegie Hall on “the greatest evening in show-business history.” Now the jacket that got away is coming home.

title: Russia Close to Its Biggest Capture of a Ukrainian City Since 2023
summary: The Kremlin is focusing its fire on Pokrovsk, a gateway to the Donetsk region, which Russia’s president, Vladimir V. Putin, has long coveted.

title: How China’s Rare Earth Chokehold Could Strangle Europe’s Military Buildup
summary: Drones, missiles and other crucial components of Europe’s rush to rearm itself rely on an increasingly unsteady supply of minerals from China.

title: Scores of Palestinian Militants Still in Israeli-Controlled Parts of Gaza, Officials Say
summary: At least some of the fighters are believed to be in the enclave’s vast tunnel network, marooned behind the “yellow line” that Israeli forces withdrew to as part of the cease-fire.

title: AR-15 Ammunition at a Crime Scene? Good Odds This Army Plant Made It.
summary: Popular AR-15 ammunition made at an Army-owned facility was far more likely than any other to turn up in a government database tracking evidence from gun crimes, new data shows.

title: Canada Is About to Lose Its Status as Having Eliminated Measles
summary: One province with an outsize number of cases has seen a collision of politics and public health policy.

title: The U.S. Is Skipping This Year’s Climate Summit. For Many, That’s OK.
summary: World leaders, gathering in Brazil, will try to agree on new, more ambitious plans to cut greenhouse gases.

title: COP30 U.N. Climate Talks Are Starting in Brazil. Here’s What to Know.
summary: Diplomats and leaders from around the world are gathering on the edge of the Amazon rainforest for annual talks on how to limit global warming.

title: How ‘The Office’ Memes Became the Language of the Internet
summary: Oh my God, OK, it’s happening! From social-media posters to the F.C.C. chair, we are all living in Michael Scott’s world.

title: Did Liberal Feminism Ruin the Workplace?
summary: And if so, can conservative feminism fix it?

title: Seeing Those Who Are Forgotten: An Act of Witness in Appalachia
summary: A photographer spends 15 years documenting an Appalachian family and the constant pressure of poverty in their lives.

title: A Fight Over Maps
summary: We explain a California vote to flip as many as five House seats for Democrats next year.

title: Late Night Celebrates a Consequential Election Day
summary: “We needed a big night,” Jimmy Kimmel said. “Democrats have had fewer wins this year than the Jets.”

title: Mexico’s President Presses Charges Against Man Who Groped Her on the Street
summary: A video of a man touching Mexico’s first female president, Claudia Sheinbaum, shocked many Mexicans but did not surprise them. “It’s so common,” one woman said.

title: On Prince Andrews Road, a Frustrating Effort to Get a New Address
summary: Villagers in Hellesdon, England, are pushing to change the name, but local bureaucracy makes it difficult.

title: Early Blast of Winter Weather Heads East This Weekend
summary: From Saturday through the start of next week, a cold snap is expected to spread from the Midwest to the East Coast.

title: Miss Universe Organizer Apologizes After Tirade at Miss Mexico
summary: Several contestants walked out of a Miss Universe event this week when the pageant director berated Miss Mexico for not taking part in promotional activities.
